net.heroicefforts.viable.android.reg
Class RepositoryRegistry

java.lang.Object
  net.heroicefforts.viable.android.reg.RepositoryRegistry

public class RepositoryRegistry
extends Object

This class handles the persistence of Viable client applications' configuration information. This was required to fulfill the uninstall reporting requirement, as Android removes package data before the uninstall event is triggered.

Author:
jevans

Constructor Summary

          Create an instance of the repository.

Constructor Detail

RepositoryRegistry

public RepositoryRegistry(android.content.Context ctx)
Create an instance of the repository.

Parameters:
ctx - a Viable context.
Method Detail

modify

public void modify(int uid)
Save or update the registry entry for the specified uid. If the supplied uid is not a Viable client application, then no action is taken.

Parameters:
uid - the system assigned uid

getEntryForUID

public RegEntry getEntryForUID(int uid)
Return the entry for the specified Viable client application's uid

Parameters:
uid - the system assigned uid
Returns:
the client app's entry, or null if the uid does not exist or represents an app that is not a Viable client application.

deleteForUID

public void deleteForUID(int uid)
Delete any entry related to the specified uid, if it exists.

Parameters:
uid - the system assigned uid

getEntryForApp

public RegEntry getEntryForApp(String appName)
Retrieves an entry for the specified application label.

Parameters:
appName - the client application's label.
Returns:
the entry or null if no entry has been registered for the application.
